abstract: Sen Orrin G Hatch is expressing objections to language in Trans-Pacific Partnership that would limit brand-name drug makers' monopoly protections abroad for new medications known as biologics, and has gone so far as to suggest trade deal should be renegotiated; Hatch was instrumental in negotiating trade deal, and many now question whether his stance on biologics will torpedo chances that Congress will approve deal.
lead_paragraph: Senator Orrin G. Hatch objects to language that would limit brand-name drug makers’ monopoly protections abroad for their cutting-edge medicines known as biologics.

headline.main: Utah Senator, Crucial Ally for the Pacific Rim Trade Deal, Is Now Its Main Hurdle
headline.print_headline: Utah Senator, Crucial Ally for the Pacific Rim Trade Deal, Is Now Its Main Hurdle

snippet: Senator Orrin G. Hatch objects to language that would limit brand-name drug makers’ monopoly protections abroad for their cutting-edge medicines known as biologics.
